author: chfast
content: In the Merkle-Patricia Trie can the keys have different lengths?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yes, for instance in TxTrie of blocks the keys are RLP encoded by their index (so 0, 1, 2...). For "secure tries" (anything related with the state trie) the keys are always hashed before they are put in the trie, so those keys are always 32 bytes

author: jochembrouwer
content: (So, inside EVM MPT only has 32 length keys)

author: wjmelements
content: Is there an ERC for the ABI standard? It's referenced in several ERCs but I don't think it has its own.

author: chfast
content: I know this is how MPT is used in practice. But in theory this also seems impossible. E.g. How would you create a trie of keys `0` and `00`?
